unit_learning_outcomes.description: Communicate ideas using a range of media including written and oral language, visual and aural representations and performance.
Design a research project that adheres to Indigenous research protocols and guidelines and incorporates specific community restrictions.
Articulate the diversity and complexity of Indigenous Knowledges, cultures and identities in terms of continuity.
Apply a critical and reflective understanding about Indigenous peoples and their understandings of themselves and in the world.
Utilise Indigenous knowledges scholarship in all written and oral assessments.

data.description: This unit requires students to draw on knowledge and skills in Indigenous Studies to develop a local site specific research project. Students will define their community and conceptualise ways of knowing, doing and being as it relates to their specific community. As active educators and learners students will also draw on their own knowledges and share with their peers. This unit applies knowledge that is drawn from traditional and contemporary means.
data.title: Indigenous Research Project
